links.title: Linux Security Checklist
links.description: Community-maintained hardening checklist for Linux desktops and laptops.

tips.title: Enable Full Disk Encryption
tips.content: Use LUKS or VeraCrypt to encrypt your drive, especially on laptops. This protects your data in case the device is lost or stolen.

tips.title: Use a Password Manager
tips.content: Avoid reusing passwords. Use open-source tools like Bitwarden or KeePassXC to securely store and manage your credentials.

tips.title: Avoid Using Root
tips.content: Run as a regular user and only use sudo when necessary. This reduces the chance of system-wide damage or compromise.

tips.title: Secure SSH Access
tips.content: Use SSH keys instead of passwords, disable root login, and change the default port to harden SSH access.

tips.title: Update Regularly
tips.content: Security patches are critical. Enable automatic security updates if your distro supports it.

tips.title: Use AppArmor or SELinux
tips.content: Mandatory access control systems like AppArmor or SELinux confine apps and reduce damage from misbehaving or malicious software.
